intro: Gaudichaudia pentandra subsp. arnottiana, commonly known as the Arnold's gaudichaudia, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a shrub characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal or sandy soils and is adapted to saline environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
